CosineTree constructor for the root node of the tree.

detaileddescription.para: It initializes the necessary variables required for splitting of the node, and building the tree further. It takes a pointer to the input matrix and calculates the relevant variables using it.

parameterdescription.para: Matrix for which cosine tree is constructed.

briefdescription.para: CosineTree constructor for nodes other than the root node of the tree.

detaileddescription.para: It takes in a pointer to the parent node and a list of column indices which mentions the columns to be included in the node. The function calculate the relevant variables just like the constructor above.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the parent cosine node.
Pointer to vector of column indices to be included.

memberdef.argsstring: (const arma::mat &dataset, const double epsilon, const double delta)
memberdef.name: CosineTree

briefdescription.para: Construct the CosineTree and the basis for the given matrix, and passed 'epsilon' and 'delta' parameters.

detaileddescription.para: The CosineTree is constructed by splitting nodes in the direction of maximum error, stored using a priority queue. Basis vectors are added from the left and right children of the split node. The basis vector from a node is the orthonormalized centroid of its columns. The splitting continues till the Monte Carlo estimate of the input matrix's projection on the obtained subspace is less than a fraction of the norm of the input matrix.

parameterdescription.para: Matrix for which the CosineTree is constructed.
Error tolerance fraction for calculated subspace.
Cumulative probability for Monte Carlo error lower bound.

briefdescription.para: Copy the given tree.

detaileddescription.para: Be careful! This may use a lot of memory.

parameterdescription.para: Tree to copy from.

briefdescription.para: Move the given tree.

detaileddescription.para: The tree passed as a parameter will be emptied and will not be usable after this call.

parameterdescription.para: Tree to move.

briefdescription.para: Clean up the CosineTree: release allocated memory (including children).
Set the basis vector of the node.
Get the basis vector of the node.

memberdef.argsstring: (arma::vec &cDistribution, double value, size_t start, size_t end)
memberdef.name: BinarySearch

briefdescription.para: Sample a column based on the cumulative Length-Squared distribution of the cosine node, and a randomly generated value in the range [0, 1].

detaileddescription.para: Binary search is more efficient than searching linearly for the same. This leads a significant speedup when there are large number of columns to choose from and when a number of samples are to be drawn from the distribution.

parameterdescription.para: Cumulative LS distribution of columns in the node.
Randomly generated value in the range [0, 1].
Starting index of the distribution interval to search in.
Ending index of the distribution interval to search in.

briefdescription.para: Calculate centroid of the columns present in the node.

detaileddescription.para: The calculated centroid is used as a basis vector for the cosine tree being constructed.

briefdescription.para: Calculate cosines of the columns present in the node, with respect to the sampled splitting point.

detaileddescription.para: The calculated cosine values are useful for splitting the node into its children.

parameterdescription.para: Vector to store the cosine values in.

briefdescription.para: Get pointer to the centroid vector.
Sample a point from the Length-Squared distribution of the cosine node.

detaileddescription.para: The function uses 'l2NormsSquared' to calculate the cumulative probability distribution of the column vectors. The sampling is based on a randomly generated value in the range [0, 1].

briefdescription.para: Sample 'numSamples' points from the Length-Squared distribution of the cosine node.

detaileddescription.para: The function uses 'l2NormsSquared' to calculate the cumulative probability distribution of the column vectors. The sampling is based on a randomly generated values in the range [0, 1].

briefdescription.para: Constructs the final basis matrix, after the cosine tree construction.

parameterdescription.para: Priority queue of cosine nodes.

briefdescription.para: This function splits the cosine node into two children based on the cosines of the columns contained in the node, with respect to the sampled splitting point.

detaileddescription.para: The function also calls the CosineTree constructor for the children.

briefdescription.para: Get the Frobenius norm squared of columns in the node.
Get pointer to the dataset matrix.
Returns the basis of the constructed subspace.
Set the Monte Carlo error.
Get the Monte Carlo error.
Get pointer to the left child of the node.
Modify the pointer to the left child of the node.
Calculates the orthonormalization of the passed centroid, with respect to the current vector subspace.

parameterdescription.para: Priority queue of cosine nodes.
Centroid of the node being added to the basis.
Orthonormalized centroid of the node.
Address to additional basis vector.

briefdescription.para: Estimates the squared error of the projection of the input node's matrix onto the current vector subspace.

detaileddescription.para: A normal distribution is fit using weighted norms of projections of samples drawn from the input node's matrix columns. The error is calculated as the difference between the Frobenius norm of the input node's matrix and lower bound of the normal distribution.

parameterdescription.para: Node for which Monte Carlo estimate is calculated.
Priority queue of cosine nodes.
Address to first additional basis vector.
Address to second additional basis vector.

briefdescription.para: Get number of columns of input matrix in the node.
Copy the given Cosine Tree.

parameterdescription.para: The tree to be copied.

briefdescription.para: Take ownership of the given Cosine Tree.

parameterdescription.para: The tree to take ownership of.

briefdescription.para: Get pointer to the parent node.
Modify the pointer to the parent node.
Get pointer to the right child of the node.
Modify the pointer to the left child of the node.
Get the column index of split point of the node.
Get the indices of columns in the node.
